basics.name: Siddarth Jain
basics.summary: A researcher with over a decade of experience advancing robotic autonomy through data-driven and geometric vision and learning algorithms, with expertise in human-robot interaction and robotic manipualtion.

work.name: Mitsubishi Electric Research Laboratories (MERL)
work.summary: I lead research and development in the optimization and robotics team, driving technical advancements across multiple project areas, resulting in top-tier publications and patents. I also lead internal research proposals, shaping directions and objectives. In addition, I mentor graduate research interns, providing technical guidance and supporting their progress on key research initiatives.

work.name: Shirley Ryan AbilityLab
work.summary: I have made research contributions in shared autonomy and robot perception for assistive robotics, including developing geometric perception algorithms that detect high-level navigation and manipulation goals. My work also introduced new approaches to assistive robotic-arm teleoperation. I formalized intent-recognition models using Recursive Bayesian inference, enabling more reliable shared autonomy for people with motor impairments. My work also introduced method for shared autonomy using a Body-Machine Interface (BMI). These contributions were validated through controlled experiments and user studies with end-users.

work.name: Innovations Lab, Northwestern Feinberg School of Medicine
work.summary: I designed and implemented image-analysis algorithms to automatically assess the quality and progression of TEF repair surgical procedures, conducting performance evaluation on video-taped operative cases. This contribution advanced objective, video-based assessment methods in pediatric surgery and was selected as a top 10 oral research abstract at the IPEG 2015 conference

work.name: GE Global Research
work.summary: I developed novel systems and methods for automated human-hand ultrasound scanning to support the diagnosis and monitoring of rheumatoid arthritis. This work included implementing deep learning models for hand detection and designing 3D geometric joint models that enable precise, automated scanning through robotic manipulation.
